title: Black Square Button

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Geometric shapes
emoji_net_data.definition: Black Square Button was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this emoji: Copy http://emojipedia.org/black-square-button/
emoji_net_data.name: black square button

bn:00110512a: Having a pleasing shape, pleasant to look at
Having a well-proportioned and pleasing shape

bn:00103545a: Of or relating to or determined by geometry
Of, or relating to geometry; geometric.

bn:00111824a: Not thin; of a specific thickness or of relatively great extent from one surface to the opposite usually in the smallest of the three solid dimensions
Relatively great in extent from one surface to the opposite in its smallest solid dimension.
Relatively great in extent from one surface to another.
Relatively large distance from one surface to the opposite in its smallest solid dimension.

bn:00111084a: Forming a right angle, especially at right angles with the mast or the keel, and parallel to the horizon; said of the yards of a square-rigged vessel when they are so braced.
Having four equal sides and four right angles or forming a right angle

bn:00089764v: To enter data into a system.
Enter (data or a program) into a computer

bn:00088531v: Add a decorative border to a picture.
Enclose in a frame, as of a picture
Of a picture such as a painting or photograph, to place inside a decorative border.

bn:00012524n: A (usually rectangular) container; may have a lid
A cuboid space; a container, usually with a hinged lid.
Box describes a variety of containers and receptacles for permanent use as storage, or for temporary use often for transporting contents.
Or any of a variety of containers or receptacles

bn:00030170n: In electrical engineering, a switch is an electrical component that can break an electrical circuit, interrupting the current or diverting it from one conductor to another.
Electrical component that can break an electrical circuit
A device to turn electric current on and off or direct its flow.
Control consisting of a mechanical or electrical or electronic device for making or breaking or changing the connections in a circuit
A circuit element that has two states, on and off.
Device to turn electric current on and off or direct its flow.
